com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine

Interface IRuleEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRuleEngine, AnalysisEngine, DSMEngine, GaianRuleEngine

    public interface IRuleEngine
    Defines a common set of function for our rule engine. The engine must be started using start() before any tuples can be added and processed.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Field Detail

      • TUPLE_KEY_INDEX

        static final int TUPLE_KEY_INDEX
        The index into the tuples of the tuple entry (i.e. column) containing the key used to lookup URIs used to send tuples. The key is a node id value corresponding to an instance id from an IApplicationDescriptor. Indexing is 0-based.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addTuples

        void addTuples(java.lang.String table,
             ITuple... tuples)
               throws DSMException
        A convenience method over addTuples(ITupleSet...) that create a tuple set for the given tuples using the underlying storage's ITupleSetDescriptor for the table with the given name. An ITupleSetDescriptor is created for the tuples using the named table's descriptor. Then call addTuples(ITupleSet...).
        Parameters:
        table - name of table to which tuples will be added.
        tuples - one or more tuples to be added to the given table.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • addTuples

        void addTuples(ITupleSet... tuples)
               throws DSMException
        Add the given input or transport tuples to the engine for processing. The input tuples must match the schema (type and value) of the table named in the tuple set's descriptor. If a Transport table, then the 'th column must contain an application instance id that matches that of this engine instance.
        Parameters:
        tuples - a tuple set to be added to the table identified by the set's ITupleSetDescriptor.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • getTuples

        ITupleSet getTuples(java.lang.String table)
                    throws DSMException
        Get all rows from the named table. In between rule evaluations, certain tables may be empty by definition. As such, the name of the table should probably only refer to tables that are known to contain values between executions. In the case of the rule language, this would be the persistent tables only.
        Parameters:
        table -
        Returns:
        null if the named table does not exist, otherwise a tuple set of table contents.
        Throws:
        DSMException - if table does not exist or other problem.

      • getTransportDescriptors

        java.util.List<ITupleSetDescriptor> getTransportDescriptors()
        Get the tuple set descriptors for all transport tables defined in the rules file being used by the engine.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getInputDescriptors

        java.util.List<ITupleSetDescriptor> getInputDescriptors()
        Get the tuple set descriptors for all input tables defined in the rules file being used by the engine.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getTargetedTransportTuples

        java.util.Collection<ITupleSet> getTargetedTransportTuples(java.lang.String nodeID)
        Get the tuple set for all the transport tables for this instance of the rule engine that are should be sent to the application with the given node id. This is generally called after an evaluation by a communication system used to send transport tuples between engines.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the destination application instance of the tuples.
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty collection.

      • getTupleState

        TupleState getTupleState()
                         throws DSMException
        Get the current set of Input, Transient, Persistent and Transport tuples and store them in a new instance of TupleState.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • start

        void start()
           throws DSMException
        Start the engine and any threads associated with it and reset any state held by the instance.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • stop

        void stop()
          throws DSMException
        Stop the engine and any threads created during it's use.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • isStarted

        boolean isStarted()
        See if the engine is started.
        Returns:

      • getReadOnlyTupleStorage

        IReadOnlyTupleStorage getReadOnlyTupleStorage()
        Get a readonly interface to the tuple storage being used by the engine. Before using this, you may find getTuples(String),getTargetedTransportTuples(String) or getTransportDescriptors() sufficient.
        Returns:

      • getApplicationDescriptor

        IApplicationDescriptor getApplicationDescriptor()
        Get the application descriptor that this engine is either running as or on behalf of.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(IEvaluationListener listener,
                     java.lang.Object callbackData)
        Remove a previously added listener and its callback data. To be removed, the same data must be provided here that was provided to addListener(IEvaluationListener, Object).
        Parameters:
        listener -
        callbackData -
        Returns:
